name: Best Actor in a Leading Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role

candidates.notes: In 1996, Steven Spielberg anonymously purchased Clark Gable's Oscar to protect it from further commercial exploitation, gave it back to the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, commenting that he could think of "no better sanctuary for Gable's only Oscar than the Motion Picture Academy".

name: Best Actress in a Leading Role
normalized_name: Best Performance by an Actress in a Leading Role

candidates.notes: Claudette Colbert was so convinced that she would lose the Oscar to write-in nominee Bette Davis that she didn't attended the ceremony originally. She was summoned from a train station to pick up her Academy Award.

name: Best Music, Original Song
normalized_name: Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures (Original Song)

name: Best Music, Score
normalized_name: Best Achievement in Music Written for Motion Pictures (Original Score)

candidates.notes: Thematic music by Victor Schertzinger and Gus Kahn.
Score by Kenneth S. Webb and Samuel Hoffenstein.

target: The Richest Girl in the World

target_enriched.name: The Richest Girl in the World
